item.dc:creator: @iwasinmoparseas101cl iwasinmoparseas101class
item.description:
@iwasinmoparseas101cl wrote:

http://www.apache.org/
http://php.net/

download those, set up your server, and then have some sort of form submission so they can register and store the data from the form into a MySQL database.

for example:

if(isset($_POST){
    $usr = $_POST['usr'];
    $pwd = $_POST['pwd'];

     $connection = mysql_connect($server, $usr, $pwd);
     $query = "INSERT INTO $table VALUES($usr, $pwd, $preferences);
     
     $success = mysql_query($query, $connection);
     if($success){
          echo "Welcome to the site! You are now a member";
     }
     else{
           echo "There was an error with your account creation";
      }
}

naturally you’ll want a bunch of checking for duplicate usernames (which you can do by just setting usrname as a primary key in your DB), you’ll have to do some password lookups, maybe some md5 hash generation if you want, preference saving/writing, etc.
